heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 08 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (179°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.7°C), outside temperature (down 4.2°C), and inside temperature (down 2.4°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 255 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.7°C), cloud levels (up 451 m), outside temperature (up 3.5°C), and dew point temperature (up 2.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 255.0m lower than yesterday, 377.2m lower than the past week, 450.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1103m minimum and 1890m maximum, with an average of 1156.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1533.2m and 1606.7m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and it’s dark. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (89%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
